spec-root.title: Verbosity Filtering - Remaining Commands Rollout
spec-root.description: Complete verbosity filtering implementation for all remaining SDD commands not covered in cli-verbosity-rollout-2025-11-15-001. Focuses on doc_query module (18 commands with large output), sdd_update metadata commands (15 commands), and other high-value commands across code_doc, run_tests, and sdd_spec_mod modules.

metadata.context: This spec completes the verbosity rollout started in cli-verbosity-rollout-2025-11-15-001, which covered 45 commands. This spec addresses the remaining ~45 commands, with priority on commands that return large JSON outputs used frequently by AI agents.
objectives: Implement verbosity filtering for all doc_query commands (18 commands)
Add verbosity support to sdd_update metadata commands (15 commands)
Apply verbosity to code_doc, run_tests, and sdd_spec_mod modules
Achieve 100% verbosity coverage across all SDD CLI commands
Reduce output size for automation/AI use cases by 40-60% in QUIET mode

phase-1.title: doc_query Module - High-Impact Commands
phase-1.description: Implement verbosity filtering for the 18 doc_query commands. These return large result sets and are frequently used by AI agents, making them the highest-priority candidates for output reduction.

metadata.rationale: doc_query commands return comprehensive codebase information with large JSON outputs. QUIET mode should show only essential identifiers, NORMAL should include basic metadata, VERBOSE should show full details including relationships and metrics.

task-1-1.title: Define field sets for doc_query commands

metadata.notes: Add 18 pairs of ESSENTIAL/STANDARD field sets for: find-class, find-function, find-module, complexity, dependencies, search, context, describe-module, stats, list-classes, list-functions, list-modules, callers, callees, call-graph, trace-entry, trace-data, impact. QUIET=essential (name/id only), NORMAL=standard (add type/location), VERBOSE=all fields
metadata.status_note: Starting autonomous mode execution - defining 18 field set pairs for doc_query commands

metadata.notes: Apply prepare_output using FIND_CLASS_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD. Target 60% reduction in QUIET mode.
Apply prepare_output using FIND_FUNCTION_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using FIND_MODULE_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using COMPLEXITY_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD. QUIET shows name+score only.
Apply prepare_output using DEPENDENCIES_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using SEARCH_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD. High-impact command.
Apply prepare_output using CONTEXT_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using DESCRIBE_MODULE_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using DOC_STATS_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
metadata.status_note: Applying verbosity filtering to doc_query stats command

metadata.notes: Apply prepare_output using LIST_CLASSES_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using LIST_FUNCTIONS_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using LIST_MODULES_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using CALLERS_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using CALLEES_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.
Apply prepare_output using CALL_GRAPH_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.

task-1-17.title: Apply verbosity to trace-entry and trace-data commands

metadata.notes: Apply prepare_output using TRACE_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD for both commands.

task-1-18.title: Apply verbosity to impact and refactor-candidates commands

metadata.notes: Apply prepare_output using IMPACT_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD and REFACTOR_CANDIDATES_ESSENTIAL/STANDARD.

verify-1-1.title: Test doc_query commands with all verbosity levels

metadata.expected: All 18 doc_query commands tested with --quiet, default, and --verbose flags. Output verified for correct field inclusion/omission.
metadata.command: Test commands: sdd doc search 'query' --quiet/--verbose, sdd doc list-classes --quiet/--verbose, etc.

verify-1-2.title: Measure output reduction for doc_query commands

metadata.expected: Sample 5 doc_query commands and measure character count reduction. QUIET mode should show 50-70% reduction compared to VERBOSE.

phase-2.title: sdd_update Metadata Commands
phase-2.description: Add verbosity filtering to 15 metadata management commands in sdd_update module. These commands typically have smaller outputs but are used in automation workflows.

task-2-1.title: Define field sets for sdd_update metadata commands

metadata.notes: Add field sets for: update-status, mark-blocked, unblock-task, add-journal, add-revision, update-frontmatter, add-verification, execute-verify, format-verification-summary, move-spec, activate-spec, complete-spec, bulk-journal, sync-metadata, update-task-metadata

task-2-2.title: Apply verbosity to sdd_update metadata commands

metadata.notes: Apply prepare_output pattern to 15 metadata command functions using field sets from task-2-1

verify-2-1.title: Test sdd_update metadata commands with verbosity

metadata.expected: Sample 5 metadata commands tested with different verbosity levels. Verify output filtering works correctly.

phase-3.title: Other High-Value Modules
phase-3.description: Add verbosity support to code_doc, run_tests, and sdd_spec_mod modules. These modules have moderate output sizes but are used in critical workflows.

task-3-1.title: Add verbosity to code_doc commands (generate, validate, analyze)

metadata.notes: Define field sets and apply prepare_output for 3 code_doc commands
Define field sets and apply prepare_output for run, discover, consult, check-tools commands
Define field sets and apply prepare_output for apply-modifications and parse-review commands

verify-3-1.title: Test Phase 3 module commands with verbosity

metadata.expected: Test representative commands from code_doc, run_tests, and sdd_spec_mod modules with different verbosity levels

phase-4.title: Low-Priority Utility Commands
phase-4.description: Add verbosity to remaining low-priority commands that have minimal output or are primarily interactive (sdd_plan, sdd_plan_review, sdd_pr, sdd_render, context_tracker, verify-tools, report).

metadata.rationale: These commands have minimal output or are primarily human-focused, so verbosity provides less value. Including for completeness and consistency.

metadata.notes: Add minimal verbosity support to: sdd_plan (create, analyze, template), sdd_plan_review (review), sdd_pr (create-pr), sdd_render (render), sdd_validate (report), sdd_next (verify-tools)
Add verbosity support to session-marker and context commands (already have some filtering but could be enhanced)

phase-5.title: Testing and Documentation
phase-5.description: Create comprehensive tests for all verbosity implementations and update documentation to reflect 100% verbosity coverage.

task-5-1.title: Create integration tests for doc_query verbosity

metadata.notes: Test all doc_query commands with QUIET/NORMAL/VERBOSE modes. Verify field filtering and output reduction.
Measure character count reduction for sample commands. Verify 40-60% reduction targets met in QUIET mode.
Document complete verbosity coverage, field sets for all commands, usage examples, and best practices for AI/automation workflows.

metadata.expected: All ~90 SDD CLI commands have verbosity support. No commands missing --quiet/--verbose flags or field filtering.

journal.title: Task Completed: Define field sets for doc_query commands
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Successfully defined 18 field set pairs for doc_query commands in output_utils.py:
- FIND_CLASS, FIND_FUNCTION, FIND_MODULE (name only → +entity_type/file/line)
- COMPLEXITY (name/complexity → +entity_type/file/line)
- DEPENDENCIES (name/imports → +imported_by/entity_type/file)
- SEARCH (name → +entity_type/file/line/relevance_score)
- CONTEXT_DOC_QUERY (name → +entity_type/file/line)
- DESCRIBE_MODULE (name/classes/functions → +file/imports/docstring/line_count/complexity)
- STATS_DOC_QUERY (core counts → +lines/complexity/metadata)
- LIST_CLASSES, LIST_FUNCTIONS, LIST_MODULES (name → +file/line/specific fields)
- CALLERS, CALLEES (name → +entity_type/file/line)
- CALL_GRAPH (nodes/edges → +entry_points/stats)
- TRACE_ENTRY (entry_point/call_depth → +execution_paths/totals)
- TRACE_DATA (data_item/lifecycle_stages → +locations/total_references)
- IMPACT (target/impacts → +affected items/risk/total)
- REFACTOR_CANDIDATES (candidates → +total/priorities)

All field sets follow the pattern: QUIET=essential (name/id), NORMAL=standard (+type/location), VERBOSE=all fields. Implementation complete in src/claude_skills/claude_skills/cli/sdd/output_utils.py:376-474.

journal.title: Task Completed: Apply verbosity to stats command (doc_query)
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Applied verbosity filtering to doc_query stats command. Changes made:
1. Added imports for prepare_output, STATS_DOC_QUERY_ESSENTIAL, and STATS_DOC_QUERY_STANDARD to cli.py
2. Modified cmd_stats function to apply prepare_output with the new field sets
3. Filtered output is now used for both JSON and text output

Implementation ensures QUIET mode shows only essential fields (total_files, total_modules, total_classes, total_functions), NORMAL mode adds standard fields (total_lines, complexity metrics, metadata), and VERBOSE mode shows all fields. Modified file: src/claude_skills/claude_skills/doc_query/cli.py:14-18, 549-559.

journal.title: Task Completed: Apply verbosity to list-classes command
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Applied verbosity filtering to list-classes command. Added LIST_CLASSES_ESSENTIAL and LIST_CLASSES_STANDARD imports from field_sets module. Modified cmd_list_classes to apply prepare_output to filter each result's data dictionary based on verbosity level.

Manual verification performed:
- --quiet: Shows only 'name' field (essential)
- Standard: Shows name, file, line, methods, bases (standard fields)
- --verbose: Shows all fields including language, docstring, properties, etc.

Files modified:
- src/claude_skills/claude_skills/doc_query/cli.py (added imports and filtering logic)

Manual verification performed:
- --quiet: Shows only 'name' field (essential)
- Standard: Shows name, file, line, complexity (standard fields that exist in data)
- --verbose: Shows all fields including parameters, docstring, decorators, calls, etc.

Files modified:
- src/claude_skills/claude_skills/doc_query/cli.py (added imports and filtering logic)

journal.title: Task Completed: Apply verbosity to call-graph command
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Applied verbosity filtering to call-graph command. Added CALL_GRAPH_ESSENTIAL and CALL_GRAPH_STANDARD imports. Modified cmd_call_graph to apply prepare_output to filter the graph dictionary based on verbosity level before output.

Implementation details:
- Filtering applied to graph dict before JSON, dot, and text output
- Field sets defined: ESSENTIAL={'nodes', 'edges'}, STANDARD={'nodes', 'edges', 'entry_points', 'stats'}
- Updated both filtered_graph variable and all references in text/dot output

Files modified:
- src/claude_skills/claude_skills/doc_query/cli.py (added imports and filtering logic)

journal.title: Task Completed: Apply verbosity to trace-entry and trace-data commands
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Applied verbosity filtering to trace-entry and trace-data commands. Added TRACE_ENTRY_ESSENTIAL, TRACE_ENTRY_STANDARD, TRACE_DATA_ESSENTIAL, and TRACE_DATA_STANDARD imports. Modified both cmd_trace_entry and cmd_trace_data to apply prepare_output to filter result dictionaries based on verbosity level before output.

Implementation details:
- trace-entry: Filters trace_result with TRACE_ENTRY field sets before JSON and text output
- trace-data: Filters trace_result with TRACE_DATA field sets before JSON and text output
- Field sets applied:
  - TRACE_ENTRY_ESSENTIAL: entry_point, call_depth
  - TRACE_ENTRY_STANDARD: adds execution_paths, total_functions, leaf_functions
  - TRACE_DATA_ESSENTIAL: data_item, lifecycle_stages
  - TRACE_DATA_STANDARD: adds read_locations, write_locations, total_references

Files modified:
- src/claude_skills/claude_skills/doc_query/cli.py (added imports and filtering logic for both commands)

journal.title: Task Completed: Apply verbosity to impact and refactor-candidates commands
journal.author: claude-code
journal.content:
Applied verbosity filtering to impact and refactor-candidates commands. Added IMPACT_ESSENTIAL, IMPACT_STANDARD, REFACTOR_CANDIDATES_ESSENTIAL, and REFACTOR_CANDIDATES_STANDARD imports. Modified both cmd_impact and cmd_refactor_candidates to apply prepare_output to filter result dictionaries based on verbosity level before output.

Implementation details:
- impact: Filters impact_result with IMPACT field sets before JSON and text output
- refactor-candidates: Filters result with REFACTOR_CANDIDATES field sets before JSON and text output
- Field sets ensure proper filtering at essential, standard, and verbose levels

Files modified:
- src/claude_skills/claude_skills/doc_query/cli.py (added imports and filtering logic for both commands)
